metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12755 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
fishProtocol::establishConnection in fish/fish.cpp in KDE kio-extras through 20.04.0 makes a cacheAuthentication call even if the user had not set the keepPassword option. This may lead to unintended KWallet storage of a password.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-12755` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

kio-extras - 4:20.08.3-1
kio-extras-data - 4:20.08.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: kio-extras package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:20.08.3-1').
